oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-09-12 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 12, 1959. Featuring David Cobb (announcer), Porter Wagoner (host/performer - although Don Gibson was advertised as the host for this week on the previous show), guest performer Carl Smith, and regular performers Minnie Pearl, the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Archie Campbell, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1040th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Porter Wagoner; Minnie Pearl; Carl Smith; Jordanaires; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: David Cobb introduces Porter Wagoner -- Uncle Pen (Porter Wagoner) -- Opening statement (Dave Cobb, Porter Wagoner) -- David Cobb introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- David Cobb and Porter Wagoner introduce Carl Smith -- Ten Thousand Drums (Carl Smith, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Porter Wagoner, Carl Smith) -- David Cobb introduces Tommy Jackson -- Mississippi Sawyer (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- David Cobb and Porter Wagoner talk -- I Thought Of God (Porter Wagoner, Jordanaires) -- David Cobb introduces Chet Atkins -- Humoresque (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Cobb, David (Announcer); Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Wagoner, Porter; Smith, Carl, 1927-2010; Price, Ray, 1926-2013
